The <kanji>ancestral festival</kanji> <kanji>dance</kanji> is the <vocabulary>ancestral festival dance</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>bon festival dance</vocabulary>.

盆踊り (<vocabulary>bon odori</vocabulary>) is a festival dance performed for Obon, a Buddhist event that honors the spirits of one's ancestors. In this dance, people often wear yukata and dance in circles around a central platform, moving in synchronized patterns. It's a fun time, be sure to attend one if you can!
